intro: Primula candidissima, commonly known as the white primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are predominantly white or pale yellow, often with a slight pinkish tinge. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and woodland settings.
